definitions.definition: To damage beyond use or repair.
To neutralize, undo a property or condition.
definitions.example: Smoking destroys the natural subtlety of the palate.
Destroying a rabid dog is required by law.

definitions.definition: To severely disrupt the well-being of (a person); ruin.
definitions.example: Her divorce destroyed her; she had a nervous breakdown and was severely depressed for more than a year.
The memory leak happened because we forgot to destroy the temporary lists.

definitions.definition: (antiphrasis) To exhaust duly and thus recreate or build up.
definitions.example: This exercise is going to destroy all parts of your shoulders.

definitions.definition: To penetrate sexually in an aggressive way.
definitions.example: She got destroyed by her lover on the carpet.
